instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage and a short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. Injected 1v and found <CHIP>U7660</CHIP> getting hot. Replaced and short is gone.

PPBUS is 12.33V now bu board stuck at 5v 0.04amps

What should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Compare diode mode readings on all coils with good board.
Don't forget L9080/580.

See if DFU helps...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
checking diode mode on L7660 found <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> shorted.

Replaced <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>, short is gone but have a pure short on <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>.

When injecting voltage only the T2 gets hot.  Sound like a shorted T2 now??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: If T2 heats with so low voltage, no other reason...
